result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan D. Braaksma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nathan D. Braaksma is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nathan D. Braaksma was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All conditions of probation shall become conditons of extended supervision should probation be revoked

miscConds.notes: Shall enroll in in-patient treatment; Must be involved in minimum weekly treatment
Shall undergo mental health assessment and follow through with any counseling as directed

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Shall not use or possess controlled substances without a legal prescription therefor;  Shall not use or possess drug paraphernalia.
Shall submit a DNA sample; If prescribed any medications, defendant must tell physician that he has strong addiction issues.

timeConds.notes:
Court will consider legitimate request for furlow for evaluation. Must be supervised by an adult at all times. Court will allow mom, girlfriend or stepfather to supervise. May be released when bed is available.
with work release and transfer privileges

findings and order
re recovery home

Attorney Greg Ernest Vollan in court for Defendant Nathan D. Braaksma.  Defendant Nathan D. Braaksma appeared by phone means.  Also appearing by phone is Agent, Pam Charvet.  There is no appearance by the State.  Atty Vollan heard, defendant is requesting to be transferred to Sober Living at Serenity in Madison upon his release.  Court questions Ms. Charvet.  Discussion continues.  Court heard;  will continue to stay jail conditioned upon defendant going to Serenity Home/Sober Living.  If defendant leaves Serenity Home or court receives a negative report, he is to report to the jail.  Court will then decide on how to proceed.  Defendant advised will need approval of the court and agent to return to Dodge County.  Attorney Vollan to draft the order.
Hearing on February 21, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nathan D. Braaksma in court, in custody with attorney Greg Ernest Vollan.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This is state's motion to revoke DPA, def is not contesting termination from TAD program.  Court finds cause to believe DPA agreement has been violated and accepts plea from 11/20/15 and finds def guilty in count 1.  Count 2 was previously DRI.  Atty Tienstra heard on sentencing recomendations.  Atty Vollan responds.  Def makes stmt.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:

42 mos Wisc State Prison System - STAYED (18 mos IC & 24 mos ES)
3 yrs probation
as COP:
  inpatient treatment
  6 mos DCJ, court will consider legitimate request for furlow for evaluation - must be supervised by an adult at all times (will allow mom, girlfriend or stepfather)
  must be involved in minimum weekly treatment
  may be released when bed is available
  99 days credit if revoked, credited against prison sentence
  maintain absolute sobriety
  no controlled substance w/o valid prescription 
  must have mental health assessment and follow through w/recomended treatment
  if prescribed any medications, must tell doctor that has strong addition issues
  court costs
  provide DNA sample and pay surcharge

Review hearing at 12-23-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Nathan D. Braaksma in court with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Moeller heard, parties have reached an agreement. Atty Tienstra heard regarding typographical error to paragraph 1 in DPA (there are only two counts; not three). Judge amends DPA accordingly. Ct. heard, explains DPA to Def, reviews charges, penalties and rights. Def. heard, pleads guilty to Ct. 1. Ct. heard, revies PQ&WOR, finds factual basis, finds plea is made FVK&I, accepts plea, withholds finding of guilt and adopts DPA as order of the court. Ct. 2 is Dismissed. Ct. heard, orders Def. to obtain HSED. Discussion held on list that Def. prepared. Discussion on TAD program and 9 mod review. Ct. heard  Review hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

(1:03) Defendant Nathan D. Braaksma in custody via video with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller (may appoint). Intern Kevin Schmidt (Barrington) appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Moeller moves to dismiss Count 1 as that stems from DPA in a 2013 case that was to have expired and been dismissed in February; State needs more time to review same; further discussion; Court will not make determination on Count 1 and a motion will need to be filed; Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause on all counts except Count 1, will not make that finding at this time. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim 10/15/15 at 8:30am in Br. 2 & Review 9/16/15 at 8:15am in Br. 4; Court sets $1,000 PA Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
